solution_line_template: The ticket costs {regular_ticket_cost} - {child_discount} = $<<{regular_ticket_cost}-{child_discount}={child_ticket_cost}>>{child_ticket_cost} for each child.
So the ticket cost of the two children is {child_ticket_cost} x {num_children} = $<<{child_ticket_cost}*{num_children}={total_child_cost}>>{total_child_cost}.
The couple needs to pay the regular price, so it's {regular_ticket_cost} x {num_adults} = $<<{regular_ticket_cost}*{num_adults}={total_adult_cost}>>{total_adult_cost}.
Thus, the family needs to pay a total of {total_child_cost} + {total_adult_cost} = $<<{total_child_cost}+{total_adult_cost}={total_family_cost}>>{total_family_cost}.
